    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In an electrifying match held at the iconic Santiago Bernab√©u Stadium, Real Madrid faced off against Ludogorets. The final scoreline read an emphatic 4-0 in favor of the home side, Real Madrid. The dominant display was observed from the very onset, rendering the visitors thoroughly overpowered and overawed.

The game commenced with Real Madrid taking control from the kickoff. Merely 20 seconds into the match, the ball went out of play, suggesting the high paced and intense nature of the game that was to follow. Shortly after the throw-in by Real Madrid at 27 seconds, the ball once again saw the sidelines within the first half-minute, hinting at the disturbance in play due to tight defending from Ludogorets.

The first real threat came from Real Madrid just after the first minute when they managed a shot on target, only to be rendered out of play moments later. This was followed by a series of corners and shots off target by Real Madrid, clearly showcasing their aggressive intent to find the back of the net early on. Ludogorets managed a temporary respite with a clearance around the two-minute mark but this did little to alleviate the relentless pressure from the home side.

Ludogorets did not squandere their own opportunities and got their first shot on target at around the 2:14 mark. Yet it was evident that Real Madrid dominated early proceedings, moving the ball quickly and efficiently to create multiple shooting opportunities.

The game's physicality came through with its share of fouls - Ludogorets conceding their first at the seventh minute executed by Real Madrid through an indirect free-kick. This was closely followed by yet another free-kick after another foul by Ludogorets at around the eight-minute mark, giving Real Madrid a continuous stream of opportunities to mount pressure.

One remarkable moment early in the game was at the 13-minute mark when Real Madrid had yet another clear chance with a shot on target, which was followed by another one around the 15:24 mark. Despite a series of clearances, throw-ins and plays being broken by the visitors, their defense could only do so much against the Galacticos‚Äô fierce attacking momentum.

A pivotal moment in the match came around the 18th minute following a corner kick and a shot on target by Real Madrid, which was immediately marred by a foul from Ludogorets. The referee made a harsh call which saw Ludogorets reduced to ten men due to a red card issued at 18:27 and a subsequent penalty awarded to Real Madrid. Real Madrid capitalized on this numerical advantage promptly, converting the penalty and netting the opening goal of the game at the 19:43 mark, firmly establishing their dominance early on.

From the 20th-minute onward, the intensity did not let up. Ludogorets, clearly on the back foot now, attempted to apply their own pressure but was seen consistently fouling and giving away possession to the Spanish giants. Another significant attempt came from Real Madrid at the 22:50 mark which saw back-to-back shots on target, even though it ultimately resulted in an offside call.

The half wore on with continued attempts by Real Madrid to extend their lead. At the 37th minute, a corner kick paved the way for another successful strike from Real Madrid‚Äîa precise finish putting them 2-0 ahead. Ludogorets found themselves consistently unable to cope with the tactical superiority and physical conditioning of their opponents.

At half-time, the score was a comfortable 2-0 for Real Madrid, having dominated both possession and chances.

The second half began with Ludogorets trying to wrest some control over proceedings with a kick-off. However, the ball was out of play just a few minutes into the half. The story of the game persisted with rapid and forceful attempts by Real Madrid. The visitors did manage to create some chances for themselves, firing a shot off target at the 4:09 mark but their overall efforts were impeded by the stringent Real Madrid defense.

Clearances and throw-ins punctuated the second half in regularity, reflective of the stoic defense and quick transition play Majorly controlled by Real Madrid. The game‚Äôs tempo, however, remained firmly in the hands of the hosts who could easily create spaces and exploit gaps left open by Ludogorets.

Substitutions began around the 14:10 mark, with Real Madrid shuffling their line-up to further strengthen their stronghold on the game and presumably rest key players. A crucial substitution came at the 15:09 mark for Ludogorets, hoping to achieve some breakthrough which continually eluded them.

A significant highlight of the game was at the 33:53 mark of the second half when Real Madrid netted their third goal of the match after a sustained period of dominance, making it glaringly evident that victory was now comfortably in their grasp. The fourth and final goal came a little later, solidifying what was likely an insurmountable comeback for Ludogorets.

Fouls and yellows cards peppered the match reflecting its intensity. Particularly noteworthy is the 40:20 mark when Real Madrid received a yellow card following a foul indicating that even in their dominative stance, they were not immune to erratic play.

By the dying minutes of the match, Real Madrid showcased their class, incredibly pressing even in the final minutes and the crowning jewel of their performance was a fourth goal coming at 42:15, ensuring their comprehensive win.

As the final whistle blew, the scoreboard read 4-0, reflecting Real Madrid‚Äôs total supremacy. The steady stream of corners, shots on target, and clinical finishes underscored their tactical and athletic superiority throughout the 90 minutes. Each goal was earned through fine build-up play and relentless pressure, epitomized by that crucial penalty early on and quick, decisive finishes that left little doubt over the visitors‚Äô frailties.

In conclusion, the match encapsulated everything a fan would expect from a Real Madrid game ‚Äì tactical excellence, clinical finishing, intense pressing, and strategic adaptability. The visitors - Ludogorets - caught trying their best, were simply no match to the spirited and class act of Real Madrid who walked away deserved victors with a clean sheet and enriched confidence for upcoming challenges. The scoreline not just an indication of goals scored but symbolizing the resounding control and footballing excellence possessed by Los Blancos on that electric night.
